result.execSummary:
The defendant Trenton L. McCorkle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(>10-50g), a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)3.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 or if not, perform 10 hours of community service per week.
Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol.

Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended.
DNA sample and surcharge.
Court finds defendant is eligible for CIP and SAP.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

records.addlTxt: of Conviction and Order-ERP
Sentencing 12/19/14
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 2:04 pm 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Zachary Glascock. 
State notes agreement of the parties on the record. 
Atty Glascock makes statement. 
COURT notes review of PSI and questions parties re: PSI. Parties have NO additions/corrections to PSI. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT ORDERS: 8 years imprisonment - 3 years IC and 5 years ES - CONDITIONS OF ES: assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended; absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol; fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 or if not, perform 10 hours of community service per week; DNA sample and surcharge; payment of court costs. 
COURT ORDERS sentence to run concurrent to any other sentence deft is serving. 
COURT finds the deft is eligible for CIP and SAP. 
COURT finds the deft is entitled to 164 days sentence credit. 
Counsel to retain copies of PSI and to maintain its confidentiality. 
Adj: 2:13 pm
Sentencing hearing on December 19, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
remainder of bond refunded - surety withdrawn
Entered in error.
Orig warrant returned from SD

Absolute sobriety.  Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 - Day report for drugs.  Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons during the pendency of this action.  Defendant must reside with family with a curfew of 9:00 p.m. to 5:00 a.m.
appeared

Case called: 2:35pm. Clerk: Denise. State appears by ADA Lesli Pluster for ADA Kyle Mayo. Defendant does not appear for BFH. Atty Zachary Glascock appears for Defendant. Atty Glascock states Defendant is currently in Lincoln Cty Jail on other charges. Crt will hold open BFH. Adjourned: 2:37pm. Recalled @ 3:04pm. State appears by ADA Lesli Pluster for ADA Kyle Mayo. Defendant appears in custody and by Atty Zach Glascock. COURT ORDERS BW QUASHED. Atty Glascock makes statement re: missed appearance. Atty Glascock moves to vacate bond and issue new bond. Arguments by State. COURT orders $500.00 Judgment. COURT reinstates $10,000 Cash Bond - conditions: no possession dangerous weapons; Absolute Sobriety; Day Report at Attic for Drugs; Defendant must reside with family; Curfew of 9pm-5am. State makes statement regarding returning $4,500 Cash to be returned to Surety M.M. Defense in agreement. COURT orders $4,500 returned to Surety, M.M. Atty Glascock to contact Surety. DATES: CC 11/7/14 @ 1pm. Adjourned: 3:09pm. MINUTES CORRECT BY CLERK AT 4:30PM ON 10/31/14

ad Prosequendum

Case called: 2:15pm. INCLUDES 14CF206, 14CM470. Clerk: Denise. State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo. Defendant does not appear. Atty Zachary Glassock appears for Defendant. Matter set for Sentencing. State moves for BW $5,000. Atty Glasscock makes statement. Crt orders BW $10,000. State indicates Surety, M.M. is present and requests money returned. Crt will not return money to Surety at this time. Crt forfets bond & sets BFH 10/31/14 @ 2:30pm BR 5. Clerk to sent notice. Crt orders PSI SEALED. Adjourned: 2:18pm.

w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Case called: 3:03pm. INCLUDES 14CF206, 14CM470. Clerk: Denise. State appears by ADA Lance Leonhard. Defendant appears by Atty Zachary Glascock. 
*VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to delete enhancer (use of dangerous weapon) in ct 1 of 14CF206- crt grants. State moves to DRI cts 2, 3, 4 & 5 in 14CF206 - crt grants. State moves to DRI 14CM470- crt grants. PLEA: NO CONTEST - amend ct 1 (poss w/intent- amphetamine (50g or less) 14CF206. Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  COURT ORDERS: PSI. State agrees to CAP sentence at WI State Prison Total of 10 yrs; Initial Confinement 5 yrs; Extended Supervision 5 yrs. Crt informs and defendant signs Ineligible Voting Form. Bond to Continue. DATES: Sentencing 9/16/14 @ 2pm.  Adjourned: 3:10pm.
